name: CALLIGRAPHY #7 - Let God.
description: Art is this special place where there is an element of I-don’t-knowness. At the edge of the Artist’s understanding is the vast unknown, the place where the next expression is coming from. When it comes, even the Artist is surprised by the new expression. The Art arts itself and the Artist is coming along for the ride just like everybody else. /// I think this is what the Artist is specifically wired to share to the society. To show others how to cultivate this state of creation, not from some logical source, but somewhere more intuitive and felt in the gut. To cultivate a state where there is trust in the movement as it comes, with no (intellectual) worry for what comes after. /// It doesn’t only come through via grandiose masterworks. It can come in something as simple as a single idea you weren’t able to perceive before. /// Where/what is the source of this expression? We’ve called it different things in different languages to different peoples. Sometimes the words suffice, but in the case of art, sometimes the entirety piece itself is what’s needed to successfully communicate this experience.
